poem:
Title: The Call of the Verdant Wilderness

In the lap of leafy theatres
where nature dons its own play,
the coins of care have ebbed in streams,
once swollen by the generous day.

Listen, you custodians of the brick,
brush off the dust of commerce, start anew,
with pockets full of seed and promise,
let the wild stage beckon you.
